snowy fields stretch in all directions.
And it was there, in the lashing snow,
that a tiny wolf sat freezing, its life
but a candle in the frigid wind.

有一只小狼在广阔雪原上冻得瑟瑟发抖。
他在猛烈的风雪中奄奄一息，
那生命之火仿佛随时都会熄灭。

風雪不斷吹打在奄奄一息的狼身上，
那生命的火焰，似乎隨時都將熄滅。

him away, a passing girl from the
nearby village saw him and wrapped
him in her arms. Her name was Sana,
and she carried the tiny wolf home.

为即将逝去的脆弱生命
而感到痛心的她抱起狼，将他带回了村落。

她對這虛弱的生命感到哀憐，

The people of her village opposed
her raising the wolf, convinced it
was a bad omen. But Sana was
stubborn, and eventually the villagers
gave into her whims with a sigh.

She called the wolf Wose, after
a warrior who had once protected
the land. She hoped the name

big and brave.
